meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'withe': more flexible or supple
meanings.sent1: The withier branches bent easily in the wind.
meanings.sent2: The withier vines were able to twist around the fence posts.
meanings.sent3: The withier rope could even tie itself in knots!
meanings.sent4: Her withier movements on the dance floor were like flowing water.
meanings.sent5: The withier fabric draped gracefully over the chair.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'withe': more slender or wiry
meanings.sent1: The withier tree swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: His withier frame allowed him to slip through the narrow gap.
meanings.sent3: The withier cat could fit through the smallest openings.
meanings.sent4: The withier branches reached out like delicate fingers.
meanings.sent5: The withier thread was perfect for intricate embroidery.
